properties.title: Fried chicken sandwich showdown visits Buttermilk
properties.desc: This sandwich only instills in me a sense of gripping neutrality.
properties.byline: by Mark Rabine and Julian Mark

properties.title: Fried Chicken showdown visits the Popeyes apocalypse
properties.desc: I have to say, this is one of the best chicken sandwiches I’ve had. Is this the End of Fried Chicken Sandwich History?
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Sandwich Showdown at Los Picudos
properties.desc: When I tried Los Picudos’ fried-chicken Milanesa torta for the first time, I felt a strange tingling — perhaps it was like a homecoming, perhaps the warmth of the womb.
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Sandwich Showdown stops in at Son's Addition
properties.desc: I wanted more — more of one of these great chicken sandwiches. I wanted to hunker down in this slice of suburban paradise and stay there until I had three kids and a second mortgage.
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Sandwich Showdown stops in at West of Pecos
properties.desc: As I search for flavor notes, all I can find is, well, fried chicken — and really that’s the only flavor a fried chicken sandwich should have, no?
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Sandwich Showdown visits Bi-Rite
properties.desc: The only proper way to eat, and evaluate, a fried chicken sandwich from Bi-Rite is al fresco, on a sparkling SF day in Dolores Park.
properties.byline: by Mark Rabine and Julian Mark

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Sandwich Showdown visits Media Noche
properties.desc: There’s no beating around the bush here. This was one of the worst fried chicken sandwiches I have ever had. It might even be the worst sandwich I’ve ever had, period.
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Showdown in SF's Mission takes a detour to Wes Burger
properties.desc: Its crunch is uncontested. My skull reverberated with it. There’s no Pepto-Bismol sauce to weaken this crust, and if there were, this crust would defy it and laugh.
properties.byline: by Laura Wenus and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Showdown stops in at Piri Pica
properties.desc: Piri Pica is, as advertised, a high-concept, low-overhead eatery fusing contemporary Portuguese cuisine with enduring American comfort food.
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine

properties.title: The Fried Chicken Showdown visits Rhea's Cafe
properties.desc: The chicken in this sandwich — an evil-looking nebula of dense, almost tumor-like fried batter — overflowed from the bun’s perimeter, requiring me to eat nearly half the meal before getting to the sandwich itself.
properties.byline: by Julian Mark and Mark Rabine
